hints.content: Let's look at each name to see which ones can classify our shape.

##Quadrilateral

A quadrilateral is a [[☃ definition 1]] with $4$ sides.

The shape does **not** have $4$ sides, so it is **not** a quadrilateral.

[[☃ explanation 1]]

options.definition: A closed figure with straight sides.

options.explanation:
These are quadrilaterals.

![6 shapes with 4 sides. Not all sides are equal.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/d82c8ab098090a7311bca960776e59398fc5a4fb)

These are *not* quadrilaterals.

![3 shapes that do not have 4 sides.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/1c7750dd8e5931a47334a4a72af780fba6eb2d34)

hints.content:
##Rhombus

Rhombuses are quadrilaterals with $4$ sides of equal length. 

The shape is **not** a quadrilateral, so it is **not** a rhombus.

[[☃ explanation 1]]

options.explanation:
![3 shapes that all have 4 equal sides.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/499428455220bcad0543bbc547eee14652837b42)

Yes, a square is also a rhombus, because all $4$ sides of a square have the same length.

hints.content:
##Square

Squares are quadrilaterals with $4$ equal sides and $4$ [[☃ explanation 1]].

The shape is **not** a quadrilateral, so it is **not** a square.

[[☃ explanation 2]]

options.explanation:
We call a corner a right angle if we can fit a little square perfectly inside it.

Here is an example of a shape with $2$ right angles: 

![A shape with 4 sides. Two corners are labeled Right angle and 2 corners are labeled Not a right angle.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/f8081758208a0824fab2ae3e0aa5470ed9d0053e)
![3 shapes with 4 equal sides and 4 right angles.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/c89a31fc913d5ff08b7b4c655e077f40d5170d66)

hints.content: None of the names can be used to classify the shape.

question.content:
**How can we classify the following shape?**

![A shape with 5 sides.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/1b49a9c246f5ba1250058aa9daa38dddcd922c77)

[[☃ radio 1]]
